db:abstract.db:para: The Positioning module provides positioning information via QML and C++ interfaces.

db:article.db:para: The Positioning module provides positioning information via QML and C++ interfaces.

db:listitem.db:para: The QGeoAddress class represents an address of a QGeoLocation.
The QGeoAreaMonitorInfo class describes the parameters of an area or region to be monitored for proximity.
The QGeoAreaMonitorSource class enables the detection of proximity changes for a specified set of coordinates.
The QGeoCircle class defines a circular geographic area.
The QGeoCoordinate class defines a geographical position on the surface of the Earth.
The QGeoLocation class represents basic information about a location.
The QGeoPath class defines a geographic path.
The QGeoPolygon class defines a geographic polygon.
The QGeoPositionInfo class contains information gathered on a global position, direction and velocity at a particular point in time.
The QGeoPositionInfoSource class is an abstract base class for the distribution of positional updates.
The QGeoPositionInfoSourceFactory class is a factory class used as the plugin interface for external providers of positioning data.
The QGeoRectangle class defines a rectangular geographic area.
The QGeoSatelliteInfo class contains basic information about a satellite.
The QGeoSatelliteInfoSource class is an abstract base class for the distribution of satellite information updates.
The QGeoShape class defines a geographic area.
The QNmeaPositionInfoSource class provides positional information using a NMEA data source.
The QNmeaSatelliteInfoSource class provides satellite information using an NMEA data source.

db:section.db:title: Using the Module
db:section.db:para: Using a Qt module requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module components in the Qt6 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS Positioning) target_link_libraries(mytarget PRIVATE Qt6::Positioning)
